channel.description: Recent content in Packet Switched Networks on 0x000216

item.title: Business Ethernet Vs T1
item.description:
For decades, small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) have relied heavily on T1 lines. However, a new service called Business Ethernet is emerging as a strong competitor, offering comparable performance at a lower cost. Business Ethernet, also referred to as Metro Ethernet, Ethernet over Copper, or Ethernet over Fiber, provides advantages such as scalable bandwidth options, reduced cost per Mbps, and wider availability. Its name emphasizes that Ethernet is no longer limited to Local Area Networks (LANs) and carriers, as it’s rapidly being adopted by SMBs...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/business-ethernet-vs-t1/

item.title: VoIP Phone Service Provides Flexibility
item.description:
Businesses of all sizes might be considering upgrading their phone systems but are unsure of the best approach. Should they stick with their existing Key Telephone or PBX system and upgrade it, or is it time to transition to VoIP? What many businesses may not realize is the wide range of options that VoIP solutions offer. The key difference between VoIP and traditional phone systems lies in its network-based approach. While even a single-line phone or cell phone operates on a network, known as the Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN), this network has limitations...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/voip-phone-service-provides-flexibility/

item.title: Ethernet over Copper vs Bonded T1
item.description:
T1 lines have long been considered a reliable connection option for small to medium businesses, gaining traction as prices dropped in recent years. However, a new technology called Ethernet over Copper (EoC) offers even greater bandwidth at a lower cost and with simpler connectivity. EoC, like T1, uses existing twisted-pair telephone wiring commonly found in business locations. Traditional T1 lines use two twisted pairs within this wiring, allowing for simultaneous two-way data transfer at 1...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/ethernet-over-copper-vs-bonded-t1/

item.title: Ethernet over TDM
item.description:
You might be familiar with Ethernet over Copper and Ethernet over Fiber, but have you encountered Ethernet over TDM? It’s worth understanding this technology and its potential benefits.
](http://www.copperethernet.com/)
TDM, or Time Division Multiplexing, forms the foundation of T1 lines and SONET fiber optic services. It became the standard for the Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN) during its transition from analog to digital in the mid-20th century and remains relevant due to its continued prevalence...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/ethernet-over-tdm/

item.title: Voice over Internet Protocol Phone Services
item.description:
The increasing popularity of Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) suggests it will likely replace traditional phone services, including landlines and ISDN PRI. This shift is primarily driven by the transition from traditional telephone networks to computer-based networks, further complicated by the emergence of wireless voice and data services. Telephone networks, largely analog during their long history, were initially designed solely for voice communication. While attempts were made to use them for data transfer with analog modems, the limited bandwidth of these networks proved insufficient for anything beyond low-speed data...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/voice-over-internet-protocol-phone-services/

item.title: What Is MPLS?
item.description:
MPLS networks are frequently mentioned as a way to connect multiple business locations. But what exactly is MPLS, and why is it superior to other network architectures? MPLS, or Multi-Protocol Label Switching, is a technology distinct from traditional circuit-switched or packet-switched networks. While it allows IP traffic transmission, it doesn’t rely on IP routing. The advantage of MPLS networks lies in their ability to handle almost any protocol without requiring conversions to fit the network structure...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/what-is-mpls/

item.title: Two Routes to Virtual Private Networking
item.description:
VPNs have become the go-to solution for connecting multiple business locations due to their cost-effectiveness and ease of maintenance. Managed service providers allow businesses to enjoy secure multipoint communication without the burden of extensive staffing or high monthly line lease fees. Virtual private networking is now cloud-based, but the choice of cloud type remains. You can opt for a VPN solution using the public internet or choose a completely private network for enhanced performance...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/two-routes-to-virtual-private-networking/

item.title: Ethernet Service Providers Offer Cost Savings
item.description:
A significant technological shift is happening with the change from circuit-switched to packet-switched WAN protocols, noticeable when businesses seek bandwidth upgrades. Instead of familiar T1 lines, they’re encountering Ethernet over Copper. This shift is fueled by the telecom industry’s move towards all-IP networks. Devices like computers, servers, and smartphones generate traffic surpassing traditional telephony, pushing the need to connect LANs and access the internet. Traditional telephone technologies like T-Carrier and SONET are being replaced with a more unified approach...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/ethernet-service-providers-offer-cost-savings/

item.title: What is Metro E?
item.description:
Metro Ethernet (Metro E) is a widely used network service experiencing rapid growth. Similar to the Ethernet protocol used in Local Area Networks (LANs), Metro E has been adapted for Metropolitan Area Networks (MANs) through standardization efforts by the Metro Ethernet Forum (MEF), an industry group focused on Carrier Ethernet. Here’s why Metro E deserves your attention as a potential solution for your business: it’s a better fit for contemporary packet-switched networks compared to older telecom options like T1...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/what-is-metro-e/

item.title: What Is VoIP For Business?
item.description:
There’s a lot of talk about the benefits of switching from traditional phone services to VoIP, and for good reason. Businesses can gain a lot from enterprise VoIP solutions. However, there are potential downsides to watch out for to ensure a smooth transition. Let’s start by clarifying what VoIP is and how it compares to your current phone service. One thing that often causes confusion about VoIP is the name itself...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/what-is-voip-for-business/

item.title: Hosted VoIP Can Improve Telephone Reliability
item.description:
Many businesses, even large ones, hold onto their own phone systems believing it’s the only way to guarantee reliable communication. But is this true, or is it time to reconsider this assumption? The phone service industry has experienced a significant shift with the emergence of hosted PBX (HPBX), also called hosted VoIP or cloud communications. Like other cloud-based technologies, this is a game-changer. In the future, we’ll wonder why we didn’t switch sooner...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/hosted-voip-can-improve-telephone-reliability/

item.title: VPLS over MPLS Connects Locations Worldwide
item.description:
Older technologies like frame relay and TDM point-to-point connections are being replaced by MPLS networks. This shift from switched circuit to packet-switched networks reflects the declining significance of traditional telephone traffic in global voice, data, and video communication. MPLS’s adaptability makes it the preferred WAN technology. The acronym’s MP stands for Multi-Protocol, signifying its ability to handle various traffic types. By attaching a label to each packet, MPLS ensures seamless transmission from origin to destination via Label Switching (LS)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/vpls-over-mpls-connects-locations-worldwide/
